result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of Plea Hearing ( 32 pages) commencing 08-05-2022 by Kathleen S. Worden.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Alexander Sr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Michael Alexander Sr.  Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case could not be heard on today's date due as network connection within the entire courtroom has failed and is not likely to be restored today, no record can be taken of the hearing.
A spin courtroom was not available.
Case is rescheduled for sentencing in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms
Report submitted to the court by defense counsel as to sentencing - received
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Michael Alexander Sr in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Michael Alexander Sr.  Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense counsel filed motion to adjourn today's scheduled sentencing hearing.
Defense counsel advises Court that defendant is prepared to proceed to sentencing on today's date.
PSI was ordered.  As motion was filed to adjourn, Court is not prepared to proceed to sentencing on today's date.
Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms
Motion To Adjourn Sentencing Hearing - received
signed, filed and sent thru the DOC interface

Defendant Michael Alexander in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Michael Alexander in custody.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNTS 1 and 4:
  Defendant changes plea to NO CONTEST. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

AS TO OCUNTS 2 and 3: Per the plea negotiations and on the State's Motion, Court ordered Counts 2 and 3 dismissed and read in.

PSI was ordered. Case set for sentencing on 10-3-22 at 9:00 am. -- gmb  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court, defendant Michael Alexander not in court, in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury trial is scheduled for 8-8-22 at 9:00 am.  Defense is requesting a plea hearing date.  Case is adjourned to 8-5-22 at 1:30 pm for a plea hearing date.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Alexander in court with Attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Michael Alexander in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Defense counsel advises Court there is a possible resolution to this case prior to trial.
State advises Court that ruling has not yet been issued as to Other Acts motion.
Discussion with the parties.
Court orders case remain scheduled for jury status hearing and jury trial in Branch 28.

Defendant Michael Alexander in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Michael Alexander in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Court reviewed Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail. Discussion placed on the record. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail.   All parties are notified that effective June 13, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Mark Sanders, Branch 28, in Room 620 of the Safety Building. Case remains set for 7/13/22 Final Pretrial at 2:30.

Defendant Michael Alexander in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Michael Alexander in custody.  Kathryn Ginsberg on behalf of Erin Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Defense has received discovery, but no offer. For reasons stated on the record, defense requests bail review, final pretrial, and jury trial dates.  All parties are notified that effective June 13, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Mark Sanders, Branch 28, in Room 620 of the Safety Building.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Case calendared for Scheduling Conference May 2, 2022.  Court not in session on that date.  Parties agree via email to May 17, 2022 at 9:00 am.  bm

Defendant Michael Alexander in court with Attorney Michael J Cerniglia; both appear by video.  Defendant Michael Alexander in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective A. Ojdana. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
received and filed.

Court ordered no contact with A.W, D.H and K.R
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list. The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Michael Alexander in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Michael Alexander in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael Alexander appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
